[U S women’s gymnasts place their names in history with Olympic team gold]  Biles made history for the United States, too, which became the first country to win four consecutive   Olympic golds in women’s gymnastics  —   a streak that started with Carly Patterson in 2004 and was continued by Nastia Liukin in 2008 and Gabby Douglas in 2012.

Her triumph makes her the fourth American in succession to win the title    following the successes of Carly Patterson, Nastia Liukin and Gabby Douglas    which is the longest winning streak by a country in the Olympic discipline.
